005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.AbstractCodedMetapathException;
009
010/**
011 * FORG: Exceptions related to argument types.
012 */
013public class InvalidArgumentFunctionException
014    extends AbstractCodedMetapathException {
015
016  /**
017   * <a href=
018   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#ERRFORG0001">err:FORG0001</a>: A
019   * general-purpose error raised when casting, if a cast between two datatypes is
020   * allowed in principle, but the supplied value cannot be converted: for example
021   * when attempting to cast the string "nine" to an integer.
022   */
023  public static final int INVALID_VALUE_FOR_CAST = 1;
024  /**
025   * <a href=
026   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#ERRFORG0002">err:FORG0002</a>:
027   * Raised when either argument to fn:resolve-uri is not a valid URI/IRI.
028   */
029  public static final int INVALID_ARGUMENT_TO_RESOLVE_URI = 2;
030  /**
031   * <a href=
032   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#ERRFORG0006">err:FORG0006</a>:
033   * Raised by functions such as fn:max, fn:min, fn:avg, fn:sum if the supplied
034   * sequence contains values inappropriate to this function.
035   */
036  public static final int INVALID_ARGUMENT_TYPE = 6;
037
038  /**
039   * the serial version UUID.
040   */
041  private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
042
043  /**
044   * Constructs a new exception with the provided {@code code}, {@code message},
045   * and {@code cause}.
046   *
047   * @param code
048   *          the error code value
049   * @param message
050   *          the exception message
051   * @param cause
052   *          the original exception cause
053   */
054  public InvalidArgumentFunctionException(int code, String message, Throwable cause) {
055    super(code, message, cause);
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Constructs a new exception with the provided {@code code}, {@code message},
060   * and no cause.
061   *
062   * @param code
063   *          the error code value
064   * @param message
065   *          the exception message
066   */
067  public InvalidArgumentFunctionException(int code, String message) {
068    super(code, message);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Constructs a new exception with the provided {@code code}, no message, and
073   * the {@code cause}.
074   *
075   * @param code
076   *          the error code value
077   * @param cause
078   *          the original exception cause
079   */
080  public InvalidArgumentFunctionException(int code, Throwable cause) {
081    super(code, cause);
082  }
083
084  @Override
085  public String getCodePrefix() {
086    return "FORG";
087  }
088}
